entry.label: Creation
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was brought into existence

entry.label: Publication
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was issued

entry.label: Revision
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended

entry.label: Download
entry.description: Online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another

entry.label: Information
entry.description: Online information about the resource

entry.label: Offline access
entry.description: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider

entry.label: Order
entry.description: Online order process for obtening the resource

entry.label: Search
entry.description: Online search interface for seeking out information about the resource

entry.label: Digital document
entry.description: Digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)

entry.label: Digital image
entry.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

entry.label: Hardcopy document
entry.description: Representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Hardcopy image
entry.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Digital map
entry.description: Map represented in raster or vector form

entry.label: Hardcopy map
entry.description: Map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Digital model
entry.description: Multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

entry.label: Hardcopy model
entry.description: 3-dimensional, physical model

entry.label: Digital profile
entry.description: Vertical cross-section in digital form

entry.label: Hardcopy profile
entry.description: Vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.

entry.label: Digital table
entry.description: Digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns

entry.label: Hardcopy table
entry.description: Representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed onpapers, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Digital video
entry.description: Digital video recording

entry.label: Hardcopy video
entry.description: Video recording on film

entry.label: Resource provider
entry.description: Party that supplies the resource

entry.label: Custodian
entry.description: Party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: Owner
entry.description: Party that owns the resource

entry.label: User
entry.description: Party who uses the resource

entry.label: Distributor
entry.description: Party who distributes the resource

entry.label: Originator
entry.description: Party who created the resource

entry.label: Point of contact
entry.description: Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource

entry.label: Principal investigator
entry.description: Key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research

entry.label: Processor
entry.description: Party that has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified

entry.label: Publisher
entry.description: Party who published the resource

entry.label: Author
entry.description: Party who authored the resource

entry.label: Direct internal
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated

entry.label: Direct external
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required

entry.label: Indirect
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge

entry.label: Cross reference
entry.description: Reference from one dataset to another

entry.label: Larger work citation
entry.description: Reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part

entry.label: Part of seamless database
entry.description: Part of the same structured set of data held in a computer

entry.label: Source
entry.description: Mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates

entry.label: Stereo mate
entry.description: Part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images

entry.label: Campaign
entry.description: Series of organized planned actions

entry.label: Collection
entry.description: Accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose

entry.label: Exercise
entry.description: Specific performance of a function or group of functions

entry.label: Experiment
entry.description: Process designed to find if something is effective or valid

entry.label: Investigation
entry.description: Search or systematic inquiry

entry.label: Mission
entry.description: Specific operation of a data collection system

entry.label: Sensor
entry.description: Device or piece of equipment which detects or records

entry.label: Operation
entry.description: Action that is part of a series of actions

entry.label: Platform
entry.description: Vehicle or other support base that holds a sensor

entry.label: Process
entry.description: Method of doing something involving a number of steps

entry.label: Program
entry.description: Specific planned activity

entry.label: Project
entry.description: Organized undertaking, research, or development

entry.label: Study
entry.description: Examination or investigation

entry.label: Task
entry.description: Piece of work

entry.label: Trial
entry.description: Process of testing to discover or demonstrate something

entry.label: Point
entry.description: Each cell represents a point

entry.label: Area
entry.description: Each cell represents an area

entry.label: UCS2
entry.description: 16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UCS4
entry.description: 32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF7
entry.description: 7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF8
entry.description: 8-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF16
entry.description: 16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: 8859 Part 1
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-1, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 1 : Latin alphabet No.1

entry.label: 8859 Part 2
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-2, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 2 : Latin alphabet No.2

entry.label: 8859 Part 3
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-3, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 3 : Latin alphabet No.3

entry.label: 8859 Part 4
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-4, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 4 : Latin alphabet No.4

entry.label: 8859 Part 5
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-5, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 5 : Latin/Cyrillic alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 6
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-6, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 6 : Latin/Arabic alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 7
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-7, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 7 : Latin/Greek alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 8
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-8, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 8 : Latin/Hebrew alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 9
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-9, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 9 : Latin alphabet No.5

entry.label: 8859 Part 10
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-10, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 10 : Latin alphabet No.6

entry.label: 8859 Part 11
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-11, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 11 : Latin/Thai alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 13
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-13, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 13 : Latin alphabet No.7

entry.label: 8859 Part 14
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-14, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 14 : Latin alphabet No.8 (Celtic)

entry.label: 8859 Part 15
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-15, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 15 : Latin alphabet No.9

entry.label: 8859 Part 16
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-16, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 16 : Latin alphabet No.10

entry.label: JIS
entry.description: Japanese code set used for electronic transmission

entry.label: Shift JIS
entry.description: Japanese code set used on MS-DOS machines

entry.label: EUC JP
entry.description: Japanese code set used on UNIX based machines

entry.label: US ASCII
entry.description: United States ASCII code set (ISO 646 US)

entry.label: EBCDIC
entry.description: IBM mainframe code set

entry.label: EUC KR
entry.description: Korean code set

entry.label: Big 5
entry.description: Traditional Chinese code set used in Taiwan, Hong Kong of China and other areas

entry.label: GB2312
entry.description: Simplified Chinese code set

entry.label: Unclassified
entry.description: Available for general disclosure

entry.label: Restricted
entry.description: Not for general disclosure

entry.label: Confidential
entry.description: Available for someone who can be entrusted with information

entry.label: Secret
entry.description: Kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden from all but a select group of people

entry.label: Top secret
entry.description: Of the highest secrecy

entry.label: Image
entry.description: Meaningful numerical representation of a physical parameter that is not the actual value of the physical parameter

entry.label: Thematic classification
entry.description: Code value with no quantitative meaning, used to represent a physical quantity

entry.label: Physical measurement
entry.description: Value in physical units of the quantity being measured

entry.label: Class
entry.description: Descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior

entry.label: Codelist
entry.description: Descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior

entry.label: Enumeration
entry.description: Data type whose instances form a list of named literal values, not extendable

entry.label: Codelist element
entry.description: Permissible value for a codelist or enumeration

entry.label: Abstract class
entry.description: Class that cannot be directly instantiated

entry.label: Aggregate class
entry.description: Class that is composed of classes it is connected to by an aggregate relationship

entry.label: Specified class
entry.description: Subclass that may be substituted for its superclass

entry.label: Datatype class
entry.description: Class with few or no operations whose primary purpose is to hold the abstract state of another class for transmittal, storage, encoding or persistent storage

entry.label: Interface class
entry.description: Named set of operations that characterize the behavior of an element

entry.label: Union class
entry.description: Class describing a selection of one of the specified types

entry.label: Meta class
entry.description: Class whose instances are classes

entry.label: Type class
entry.description: Class used for specification of a domain of instances (objects), together with the operations applicable to the objects. A type may have attributes and associations

entry.label: Character string
entry.description: Free text field

entry.label: Integer
entry.description: Numerical field

entry.label: Association
entry.description: Semantic relationship between two classes that involves connections among their instances

entry.label: Row
entry.description: Ordinate (y) axis

entry.label: Column
entry.description: Abscissa (x) axis

entry.label: Vertical
entry.description: Vertical (z) axis

entry.label: Track
entry.description: Along the direction of motion of the scan point

entry.label: Cross track
entry.description: Perpendicular to the direction of motion of the scan point

entry.label: Line
entry.description: Scan line of a sensor

entry.label: Sample
entry.description: Element along a scan line

entry.label: Time
entry.description: Duration

entry.label: Complex
entry.description: Set of geometric primitives such that their boundaries can be represented as a union of other primitives

entry.label: Composite
entry.description: Connected set of curves, solids or surfaces

entry.label: Curve
entry.description: Bounded, 1-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a line

entry.label: Point
entry.description: Zero-dimensional geometric primitive, representing a position but not having an extent

entry.label: Solid
entry.description: Bounded, connected 3-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of space

entry.label: Surface
entry.description: Bounded, connected 2-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of a plane

entry.label: Blurred image
entry.description: Portion of the image is blurred

entry.label: Cloud
entry.description: Portion of the image is partially obscured by cloud cover

entry.label: Degrading obliquity
entry.description: Acute angle between the plane of the ecliptic (the plane of the Earth s orbit) and the plane of the celestial equator

entry.label: Fog
entry.description: Portion of the image is partially obscured by fog

entry.label: Heavy smoke or dust
entry.description: Portion of the image is partially obscured by heavy smoke or dust

entry.label: Night
entry.description: Image was taken at night

entry.label: Rain
entry.description: Image was taken during rainfall

entry.label: Semi darkness
entry.description: Image was taken during semi-dark conditions -- twilight conditions

entry.label: Shadow
entry.description: Portion of the image is obscured by shadow

entry.label: Snow
entry.description: Portion of the image is obscured by snow

entry.label: Terrain masking
entry.description: The absence of collection data of a given point or area caused by the relative location of topographic features which obstruct the collection path between the collector(s) and the subject(s) of interest

entry.label: Discipline
entry.description: Keyword identifies a branch of instruction or specialized learning

entry.label: Place
entry.description: Keyword identifies a location

entry.label: Stratum
entry.description: Keyword identifies the layer(s) of any deposited substance

entry.label: Temporal
entry.description: Keyword identifies a time period related to the dataset

entry.label: Theme
entry.description: Keyword identifies a particular subject or topic

entry.label: Continual
entry.description: Data is repeatedly and frequently updated

entry.label: Daily
entry.description: Data is updated each day

entry.label: Weekly
entry.description: Data is updated on a weekly basis

entry.label: Fortnightly
entry.description: Data is updated every two weeks

entry.label: Monthly
entry.description: Data is updated each month

entry.label: Quarterly
entry.description: Data is updated every three months

entry.label: Biannually
entry.description: Data is updated twice each year

entry.label: Annually
entry.description: Data is updated every year

entry.label: As needed
entry.description: Data is updated as deemed necessary

entry.label: Irregular
entry.description: Data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration

entry.label: Not planned
entry.description: There are no plans to update the data

entry.label: Unknown
entry.description: Frequency of maintenance for the data is not known

entry.label: CPIO
entry.description: CoPy In / Out (UNIX file format and command)

entry.label: TAR
entry.description: Tape ARchive

entry.label: High sierra
entry.description: High sierra file system

entry.label: ISO9660
entry.description: Information processing volume and file structure of CD-ROM

entry.label: ISO9660 Rock Ridge
entry.description: Rock ridge interchange protocol (UNIX)

entry.label: ISO9660 Apple HFS
entry.description: Hierarchical file system (Macintosh)

entry.label: CDROM
entry.description: Read-only optical disk

entry.label: DVD
entry.description: Digital versatile disk

entry.label: DVDROM
entry.description: Digital versatile disk, read only

entry.label: 3 Half Inch Floppy
entry.description: 3,5 inch magnetic disk

entry.label: 5 Quarter Inch Floppy
entry.description: 5,25 inch magnetic disk

entry.label: 7 Track tape
entry.description: 7 track magnetic tape

entry.label: 9 track tape
entry.description: 9 track magnetic tape

entry.label: 3480 Cartridge
entry.description: 3480 cartridge tape drive

entry.label: 3490 Cartridge
entry.description: 3490 cartridge tape drive

entry.label: 3580 Cartridge
entry.description: 3580 cartridge tape drive

entry.label: 4 mm Cartridge tape
entry.description: 4 millimetre magnetic tape

entry.label: 8 mm Cartridge tape
entry.description: 8 millimetre magnetic tape

entry.label: 1 Quarter inch cartridge tape
entry.description: 0,25 inch magnetic tape

entry.label: Digital linear tape
entry.description: Half inch cartridge streaming tape drive

entry.label: Online
entry.description: Direct computer linkage

entry.label: Satellite
entry.description: Linkage through a satellite communication system

entry.label: Telephone link
entry.description: Communication through a telephone network

entry.label: Hardcopy
entry.description: Pamphlet or leaflet giving descriptive information

entry.label: Mandatory
entry.description: Element is always required

entry.label: Optional
entry.description: Element is not required

entry.label: Conditional
entry.description: Element is required when a specific condition is met

entry.label: Center
entry.description: Point halfway between the lower left and the upper right of the pixel

entry.label: Lower left
entry.description: The corner in the pixel closest to the origin of the SRS; if two are at the same distance from the origin, the one with the smallest x-value

entry.label: Lower right
entry.description: Next corner counterclockwise from the lower left

entry.label: Upper right
entry.description: Next corner counterclockwise from the lower right

entry.label: Upper left
entry.description: Next corner counterclockwise from the upper right

entry.label: Completed
entry.description: Production of the data has been completed

entry.label: Historical archive
entry.description: Data has been stored in an offline storage facility

entry.label: Obsolete
entry.description: Data is no longer relevant

entry.label: On going
entry.description: Data is continually being updated

entry.label: Planned
entry.description: Fixed date has been established upon or by which the data will be created or updated

entry.label: Required
entry.description: Data needs to be generated or updated

entry.label: Under development
entry.description: Data is currently in the process of being created

entry.label: Copyright
entry.description: Exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor

entry.label: Patent
entry.description: Government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery

entry.label: Pending patent
entry.description: Produced or sold information awaiting a patent

entry.label: Trademark
entry.description: A name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer

entry.label: License
entry.description: Formal permission to do something

entry.label: Intellectual property rights
entry.description: Rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity

entry.label: Restricted
entry.description: Withheld from general circulation or disclosure

entry.label: Other restrictions
entry.description: Limitation not listed

entry.label: Attribute
entry.description: Information applies to the attribute class

entry.label: Attribute type
entry.description: Information applies to the characteristic of a feature

entry.label: Collection hardware
entry.description: Information applies to the collection hardware class

entry.label: Collection session
entry.description: Information applies to the collection session

entry.label: Dataset
entry.description: Information applies to the dataset

entry.label: Series
entry.description: Information applies to the series

entry.label: Non geographic dataset
entry.description: Information applies to non-geographic data

entry.label: Dimension group
entry.description: Information applies to a dimension group

entry.label: Feature
entry.description: Information applies to a feature

entry.label: Feature type
entry.description: Information applies to a feature type

entry.label: Property type
entry.description: Information applies to a property type

entry.label: Field session
entry.description: Information applies to a field session

entry.label: Software
entry.description: Information applies to a computer program or routine

entry.label: Service
entry.description: Information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case

entry.label: Model
entry.description: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object

entry.label: Tile
entry.description: Information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data

entry.label: Service
entry.description: Information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case

entry.label: Vector
entry.description: Vector data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: Grid
entry.description: Grid data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: Text, table
entry.description: Textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: TIN
entry.description: Triangulated irregular network

entry.label: Stereo model
entry.description: Three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images

entry.label: Video
entry.description: Scene from a video recording

entry.label: Farming
entry.description: Rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock

entry.label: Biota
entry.description: Flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

entry.label: Boundaries
entry.description: Legal land descriptions. Examples: political and administrative boundaries

entry.label: Climatology, meteorology, atmosphere
entry.description: Processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

entry.label: Economy
entry.description: Economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas

entry.label: Elevation
entry.description: Height above or below sea level. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

entry.label: Environment
entry.description: Environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

entry.label: Geoscientific information
entry.description: Information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth s rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion

entry.label: Health
entry.description: Health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services

entry.label: Imagery base maps earth cover
entry.description: Base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations

entry.label: Intelligence military
entry.description: Military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection

entry.label: Inland waters
entry.description: Inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrographic charts

entry.label: Location
entry.description: Positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names

entry.label: Oceans
entry.description: Features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters). Examples: tides, tidal waves, coastal information, reefs

entry.label: Planning cadastre
entry.description: Information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

entry.label: Society
entry.description: Characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

entry.label: Structure
entry.description: Man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers

entry.label: Transportation
entry.description: Means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

entry.label: Utilities communication
entry.description: Energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks

entry.label: Geometry only
entry.description: Geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology

entry.label: Topology 1D
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex -- commonly called chain-node topology

entry.label: Planar graph
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A planar graph is a graph that can be drawn in a plane in such a way that no two edges intersect except at a vertex.)

entry.label: Full planar graph
entry.description: 2-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A 2-dimensional topological complex is commonly called full topology in a cartographic 2D environment.)

entry.label: Surface graph
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface. (A geometric complex is isomorphic to a topological complex if their elements are in a one-to-one, dimensional-and boundry-preserving correspondence to one another.)

entry.label: Full surface graph
entry.description: 2-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface

entry.label: Topology 3D
entry.description: 3-dimensional topological complex. (A topological complex is a collection of topological primitives that are closed under the boundary operations.)

entry.label: Full topology 3D
entry.description: Complete coverage of a 3D Euclidean coordinate space

entry.label: Abstract
entry.description: Topological complex without any specified geometric realisation

entry.label: Attribute
entry.description: Information applies to the attribute class

entry.label: Attribute type
entry.description: Information applies to the characteristic of a feature

entry.label: Collection hardware
entry.description: Information applies to the collection hardware class

entry.label: Collection session
entry.description: Information applies to the collection session

entry.label: Dataset
entry.description: Information applies to the dataset

entry.label: Series
entry.description: Information applies to the series

entry.label: Non geographic dataset
entry.description: Information applies to non-geographic data

entry.label: Dimension group
entry.description: Information applies to a dimension group

entry.label: Feature
entry.description: Information applies to a feature

entry.label: Feature type
entry.description: Information applies to a feature type

entry.label: Property type
entry.description: Information applies to a property type

entry.label: Field session
entry.description: Information applies to a field session

entry.label: Software
entry.description: Information applies to a computer program or routine

entry.label: Service
entry.description: Information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case

entry.label: Model
entry.description: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object

entry.label: Tile
entry.description: Information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data

entry.label: Initiative
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as an initiative (DS_Initiative)

entry.label: Stereo mate
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a stereo mate (DS_StereoMate)

entry.label: Sensor
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a sensor (DS_Sensor)

entry.label: Platform series
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a platform series (DS_PlatformSeries)

entry.label: Sensor series
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a sensor series (DS_SensorSeries)

entry.label: Production series
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a production series (DS_ProductionSeries)

entry.label: Transfer aggregate
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has no existence outside of the transfer context

entry.label: Other aggregate
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has an existence outside of the transfer context, but which does not pertains to a specific aggregate type.
DCP is XML
entry.label: XML

entry.description: DCP is CORBA
entry.label: CORBA

entry.description: DCP is JAVA
entry.label: JAVA

entry.label: COM

entry.label: SQL

entry.description: DCP is WebServices
entry.label: Web services
Tight
entry.description: Tightly coupled: data associated

entry.label: Mixed
entry.description: Mixed coupled: data associated; in addition, external data might be processed

entry.label: Loose
entry.description: Loosely coupled: no data associated

entry.label: harmonised
entry.description: Harmonised

entry.label: interoperable
entry.description: Interoperable

entry.label: invocable
entry.description: Invocable

entry.label: XML
entry.description: XML

entry.description: CORBA

entry.description: COM
